text:
The pt is an 80M with multiple medical problems including prostate ca
   with mets to the spine. He recently was admitted for a ventral hernia
   repair and was eventually discharged to HRC. On [**9-28**] the pt presented
   from rehab with fevers, hypotension, and an altered mental status all
   c/w sepsis due to MRSA bacteremia.  His course in the MICU has been
   complicated by persistent fevers and hypoxemia as well as an impaired
   mental status.
   Fever, unknown origin (FUO, Hyperthermia, Pyrexia)
   Assessment:
   Temp to 100.7
   Action:
   MD aware, PRN Tylenol given, legionella urinary antigen sample sent,
   obtained sputum spec via NTS.
   Response:
   Temp down to 100 however on the rise again.
   Plan:
   Monitor temp curve, continue IV ABX, needs vanco level sent in AM.
   Altered mental status (not Delirium)
   Assessment:
   Minimal verbal communication, occasionally will nod to questions, not
   following commands, oriented to self only.
   Action:
   Mental status assessed frequently, daughter in to visit this afternoon,
   daughter states she does understand some of what pt is saying, claims
   pt knows where he is.
   Response:
   At times able to understand pt
s garbled speech although still not
   following commands.
   Plan:
   Continue to assess mental status, orient as needed.
   Hypoxemia
   Assessment:
   Pt on high flow neb at 50%.
   Action:
   Decreased to FiO2 of 40%.
   Response:
   Pt tolerating well, sats >95%, lungs clear, pt denies difficulty
   breathing/SOB
   Plan:
   Continue to wean O2 as tolerated by pt.
   Hypotension (not Shock)
   Assessment:
   Pt on Levophed 0.03mcg/kg/min.  CVP 6-11
   Action:
   Weaned to 0.02mcg/kg/min, then to off.
   Response:
   Pt maintain acceptable BP 90s to 120s, MAPs >50.
   Plan:
   Continue to monitor SBP/CVP, pressors remain at bedside if needed.
